action.action-desc: Mr. Price of North Carolina introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to require institutions of higher education to report revenue generated by each sports team, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Standardization of Collegiate Oversight of Revenues and Expenditures Act or the SCORE Act.

section.header: Reporting by institutions of higher education on athletic revenue and expenses
section.text: Section 485(g) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1092(g)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: The amount of revenue generated by each of the following categories, disaggregated by each sports team, if applicable:

clause.text: Distributions from any other intercollegiate athletic association, conference, or tournament.
Compensation and benefits provided by third-party support.
Broadcast and media rights, reported separately for television, radio, Internet, and print.
Endowment and investment income, reported separately for each source of such income.
Indirect institutional support for facilities, services, and administrative support.
Direct government support, reported separately by State government, local government, or the Federal Government.

subparagraph.text: The expenses attributable to each of the following categories, disaggregated by each sports team, as applicable:

clause.text: Total salaries and benefits, and salaries and benefits paid by the institution and by third parties, respectively, to head coaches, to assistant coaches, and for administrative salaries.
Education and general expenses of the institution—

subclause.text: including instruction, research, public service, academic support, student services, instructional support, and scholarships and fellowships; and
which do not include expenses with respect to auxiliary enterprises, hospitals, or independent operations.

subparagraph.text: by striking the term and inserting the following:
by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

the terms listed in each of the categories under subparagraphs (K) through (L) of paragraph (1) shall be defined by the Secretary by regulation, developed in consultation with the Secretary of the Treasury and the task force described in paragraph (6)(A), and such definitions shall be updated in accordance with paragraph (6)(B).

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall appoint a task force of nonprofit and higher education accounting experts, professionals, and organizations representing each of the following:

clause.text: Institutions of higher education that are members of division I of the National Collegiate Athletic Association.
Institutions of higher education that are members of division II of the National Collegiate Athletic Association.
Institutions of higher education that are members of division III of the National Collegiate Athletic Association.

subparagraph.text: The Secretary, on a biannual basis and in consultation with the task force described in subparagraph (A), shall review each definition under paragraph (5)(B) and, if necessary, update such definition in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles or significant changes in the national system of intercollegiate athletics.

paragraph.text: An institution of higher education that submits the information described in subparagraphs (K) through (L) of paragraph (1) to an intercollegiate athletic association for an academic year, and such information is verified by an independent audit and certified by the chancellor of the institution, may, in lieu of submitting such information under paragraph (1), request such association to directly submit such information to the Secretary on behalf of the institution for such academic year.

section.text: Section 487(a) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1094(a)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: An institution will not be a member of any intercollegiate athletic association or participate in any intercollegiate athletics competition organized by any person, unless such association or person reports, on an annual basis, to the Secretary the following, disaggregated by sport, athletic event, or contract, as applicable:

clause.text: Total generated revenue and amount of revenue generated by each of the following categories:

subclause.text: Distributions from other intercollegiate athletic organization or person.
Dues and other assessments from member institutions of higher education.
Broadcast and media rights, reported separately for television, radio, Internet, and print.
Endowment and investment income, reported separately for each source of such income.
Direct government support, reported separately by State government, local government, or the Federal Government.
Any other category determined appropriate by the Secretary.

clause.text: Amount of expenses attributable to each of the following categories:

subclause.text: Disbursements to institutions of higher educations, athletic conferences, or other persons.
Any other category determined appropriate by the Secretary.

clause.text: define by regulation, developed in consultation with the Secretary of the Treasury and the task force described in section 485(g)(6)(A), the terms listed in each of the categories under subparagraph (A); and

on a biannual basis and in consultation with such task force, review each definition under clause (i) and, if necessary, update such definition in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles or significant changes in the national system of intercollegiate athletics.
